description.zh-cn: 位于日本京都的国立综合性研究型大学，前身是1897年成立的日本第二所旧制帝国大学——京都帝国大学。作为日本最高学府之一，京大以‘自由的学风’著称，是京都学派的发祥地，被誉为‘科学家的摇篮’。
description.en: A national comprehensive research university located in Kyoto, Japan. Its predecessor was Kyoto Imperial University, established in 1897 as the second Imperial University in Japan. As one of Japan's top academic institutions, it is known for its 'spirit of freedom', is the birthplace of the Kyoto School, and is regarded as a 'cradle of scientists'.

description.zh-cn: 京都大学的前身，是一所旧制高等学校。其法学部及工学部于1897年组成了京都帝国大学，剩余部分在二战后并入京都大学。
description.en: The predecessor of Kyoto University, an old-system high school. Its faculties of law and engineering formed Kyoto Imperial University in 1897, with the remaining parts being merged into Kyoto University after World War II.

description.zh-cn: 清朝与日本之间的一场战争，其赔款被用作建立京都帝国大学（京都大学前身）的资金来源之一。
description.en: A war between the Qing dynasty and Japan, the indemnity from which was used as one of the funding sources for the establishment of Kyoto Imperial University (the predecessor of Kyoto University).

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，曾提议用日清战争赔款将第三高等学校提升为帝国大学，促成了京都大学的建立。
description.en: A Japanese statesman who proposed using the indemnity from the First Sino-Japanese War to upgrade the Third Higher School to an Imperial University, leading to the establishment of Kyoto University.

description.zh-cn: 日本教育家，京都帝国大学（京都大学前身）首任总长。
description.en: A Japanese educator, the first president of Kyoto Imperial University (the predecessor of Kyoto University).

description.zh-cn: 一个源自京都大学的哲学思想流派，由西田几多郎和[[田辺元]]开创，对日本哲学理论产生了重要影响。
description.en: A school of philosophical thought originating from Kyoto University, founded by Kitaro Nishida and Hajime Tanabe, which had a significant impact on Japanese philosophical theory.

description.zh-cn: 日本哲学家，京都大学哲学系教授，京都学派的开创者之一。
description.en: A Japanese philosopher, professor of philosophy at Kyoto University, and one of the founders of the Kyoto School.

description.zh-cn: 日本哲学家，京都大学哲学系教授，京都学派的开创者之一。
description.en: A Japanese philosopher, professor of philosophy at Kyoto University, and one of the founders of the Kyoto School.

description.zh-cn: 1933年发生在京都大学的一起有关学术思想自由的事件。因法学部教授泷川幸辰的学说受到政府压制而引发，导致多名教授辞职，并引发社会对大学自治和思想自由的深刻反思。
description.en: An incident concerning academic freedom of thought that occurred at Kyoto University in 1933. It was triggered by government suppression of the theories of Faculty of Law professor Yukitoki Takikawa, leading to the resignation of several professors and prompting profound societal reflection on university autonomy and freedom of thought.

description.zh-cn: 一项基本人权，指个人持有或思考独立于他人观点的思想、观点或信仰的自由。在泷川事件中，京都大学的学术思想自由受到严重挑战。
description.en: A fundamental human right referring to the freedom of an individual to hold or consider a fact, viewpoint, or thought, independent of others' viewpoints. The academic freedom of thought at Kyoto University was severely challenged during the Takigawa incident.

description.zh-cn: 日本刑法学家，京都大学法学部教授。因其刑法学说被指为“共产主义”，遭到政府弹压，引发了著名的“泷川事件”。战后曾任京都大学校长。
description.en: A Japanese criminal law scholar and professor at the Faculty of Law, Kyoto University. His criminal law theories were labeled as 'communist' and suppressed by the government, sparking the famous 'Takigawa incident'. He served as president of Kyoto University after the war.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，在泷川事件期间担任文部大臣，向京都大学施压要求罢免泷川幸辰教授。
description.en: A Japanese politician who, as Minister of Education during the Takigawa incident, pressured Kyoto University to dismiss Professor Yukitoki Takikawa.

description.zh-cn: 日本教育家，泷川事件期间任京都大学校长。他因拒绝文部省罢免泷川幸辰的要求而被迫辞职。
description.en: A Japanese educator who was the president of Kyoto University during the Takigawa incident. He was forced to resign after refusing the Ministry of Education's demand to dismiss Yukitoki Takikawa.

description.zh-cn: 由导演黑泽明执导的一部电影，以1933年的泷川事件为背景。
description.en: A film directed by Akira Kurosawa, set against the backdrop of the 1933 Takigawa incident.

description.zh-cn: 日本著名电影导演，执导了以泷川事件为背景的电影《我于青春无悔》。
description.en: A famous Japanese film director who directed the film 'No Regrets for Our Youth,' which was based on the Takigawa incident.

description.zh-cn: 京都大学的前身是第三高等学校。1897年，第三高等学校的法学部及工学部组成了京都帝国大学（京都大学的前称），其剩余部分也在二战后并入京都大学。
description.en: Kyoto University originated from the Third Higher School. In 1897, the faculties of law and engineering of the Third Higher School formed Kyoto Imperial University (the former name of Kyoto University), and its remaining parts were merged into Kyoto University after WWII.

description.zh-cn: 京都大学（时称京都帝国大学）的建立资金部分来源于日清战争后满清政府的赔款。
description.en: The establishment of Kyoto University (then Kyoto Imperial University) was partially funded by the indemnity paid by the Qing government after the First Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 提议使用日清战争赔款将第三高等学校提升为帝国大学，从而直接促成了京都大学的建立。
description.en: Proposed using the indemnity from the First Sino-Japanese War to upgrade the Third Higher School to an Imperial University, which directly led to the establishment of Kyoto University.

description.zh-cn: 京都大学是京都学派的发祥地。
description.en: Kyoto University is the birthplace of the Kyoto School.

description.zh-cn: 西田几多郎是京都学派的开创者之一。
description.en: Kitaro Nishida was one of the founders of the Kyoto School.

description.zh-cn: 田辺元是京都学派的开创者之一。
description.en: Hajime Tanabe was one of the founders of the Kyoto School.

description.zh-cn: 时任文部大臣的鸠山一郎对京大校长提出罢免泷川幸辰的要求，是引发泷川事件的关键人物。
description.en: As the Minister of Education at the time, Ichirō Hatoyama's demand for the dismissal of Yukitoki Takikawa was a key factor in triggering the Takigawa incident.

description.zh-cn: 泷川事件是日本学术界思想自由和大学自治受到政府压制的一次标志性事件。
description.en: The Takigawa incident was a landmark event where academic freedom of thought and university autonomy in Japan were suppressed by the government.

description.zh-cn: 由于泷川事件，泷川幸辰教授的著作被禁，并最终被迫停职、免职。
description.en: As a result of the Takigawa incident, Professor Yukitoki Takikawa's writings were banned, and he was ultimately suspended and dismissed from his position.

description.zh-cn: 在泷川事件中，校长小西重直因拒绝政府罢免泷川教授的要求，也被迫辞职。
description.en: During the Takigawa incident, President Shigenao Konishi was also forced to resign for refusing the government's demand to dismiss Professor Takikawa.

description.zh-cn: 黑泽明导演的电影《我于青春无悔》是以泷川事件为背景创作的。
description.en: The film 'No Regrets for Our Youth' directed by Akira Kurosawa was created with the Takigawa incident as its backdrop.

description.zh-cn: 担任《我于青春无悔》的导演。
description.en: Served as the director of 'No Regrets for Our Youth'.

description.zh-cn: 担任京都大学首任总长。
description.en: Served as the first president of Kyoto University.

description.zh-cn: 担任京都大学现任校长。
description.en: Serves as the current president of Kyoto University.

description.zh-cn: 战后曾担任京都大学校长。
description.en: Served as president of Kyoto University after the war.
